response.original_title: Making Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
response.overview: The Mike Nichols and Steven Soderbergh commentary on the Two-Disc Special Edition of Whoâ€™s Afraid of Virginia Woolf? (2006) is captivating throughout. Nichols reflects on his first experience as a film director, sharing both his early naivete and growing confidence. He and Soderbergh discuss his creative process, strategies, and the evolution of the project. They explore the differences and similarities between stage and screen versions and offer detailed insights into the performances of Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, George Segal, and Sandy Dennis. They also share personal anecdotes, including tales of parties gone wrong. This engaging conversation is essential for students and fans of the film. It provides rare and revealing insight into the craft of filmmaking and is equally valuable for casual viewers.
